title: How to Make Vegan Baklava

steps.headline: Grease the bottoms and sides of the pan with vegan butter and preheat the oven to 175 °F (79 °C).
Stir together the nuts and cinnamon in a bowl until well mixed.
Cut the filo paper using a knife or scissors so that it fits the size of the pan.
Put two of the filo paper sheets in the pan, brushing melted vegan butter in between.
steps.description: Continue doing so until eight of the sheets are on the pan.

steps.headline: Sprinkle 3 tablespoons (44.4 ml) of the nut mixture on each layer.
Continue layering the filo until all the ingredients have been used.
Cut the baklava into squares and bake for 50 minutes.
Boil the sugar and the water together in a saucepan until the sugar melts while baking.
Pour in the vanilla and agave nectar and allow the mixture to simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove the baklava from the oven, and pour the sauce over it while the baklava is still hot.
Allow the dish to cool to room temperature before serving.

text: Grease the bottoms and sides of the pan with vegan butter and preheat the oven to 175 °F (79 °C).  Stir together the nuts and cinnamon in a bowl until well mixed.  Cut the filo paper using a knife or scissors so that it fits the size of the pan.  Put two of the filo paper sheets in the pan, brushing melted vegan butter in between. Continue doing so until eight of the sheets are on the pan. Sprinkle 3 tablespoons (44.4 ml) of the nut mixture on each layer.  Continue layering the filo until all the ingredients have been used.  Cut the baklava into squares and bake for 50 minutes.  Boil the sugar and the water together in a saucepan until the sugar melts while baking.  Pour in the vanilla and agave nectar and allow the mixture to simmer for 20 minutes.  Remove the baklava from the oven, and pour the sauce over it while the baklava is still hot.  Allow the dish to cool to room temperature before serving.
